alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 8:48PM EDT until September 10 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the southern Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following county, Union NC. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - In particular, high stream levels are expected along Little Twelvemile Creek and East Fork Twelvemile Creek and their tributaries, and areas around Wesley Chapel and Mineral Springs. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Waxhaw, Lake Park, Mineral Springs, Hemby Bridge, Fairview In Union County and Jaars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
